main event: Two military observers reported a round object in the sky exhibiting rapid darting motions and changing colors during a sighting on January 20, 1961.
interesting points: The object appeared white or bluish-green and changed to red before burning out., The sighting lasted for about 10-12 seconds., It was observed moving rapidly with no tail, trail, or exhaust., The weather conditions were clear with a full moon during the sighting., The observers were identified as completely reliable military personnel.
witness description: Military personnel, SSGT J.D. Bourgeois (Tower Operator) and A/2C Leo Hackworth Junior (Weather Observer), both completely reliable.
